author: ESPNcricinfo staff
title: Losing whole summer would cost over £300m - ECB chief executive
description: Tom Harrison said an entire home summer without cricket was "not an outlandish scenario" | ESPNcricinfo.com
content:
Tom Harrison, the ECB's chief executive, has estimated that an entire season without cricket will cost the game in England and Wales "well in excess of £300 million".
In a letter to PCA chief executive Tony Irish, seen by ESPNcricinfo, Harrison admitted that… [+5627 chars]
